Reading tags before first section

Sometimes, you need to have tags before the first section of an INI file. Also, some INI files are headerless, i.e. contain only tags and no headers. However, MiniINI requires you to read variables from a section.

To support such files, INIFile contains a section called [DEFAULT] that contains tags before the first (if any) section. You can access it like any other section using the GetSection method.

Note: This section is called [DEFAULT], including brackets, to prevent conflicts with loaded section names as they can't contain brackets.

Example: 

ini.GetSection("[DEFAULT]");

Last update: 07-07-2010
